thread.title: Florida QB Will Grier suspended indefinitely
thread.title_full: Florida QB Will Grier suspended indefinitely

title: Florida QB Will Grier suspended indefinitely
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Florida QB Will Grier suspended indefinitely GAINESVILLE, Fla. — Coach Jim McElwain announced Monday Florida Gator redshirt freshman quarterback Will Grier has been suspended indefinitely from the team. Post to Facebook Florida QB Will Grier suspended indefinitely GAINESVILLE, Fla. — Coach Jim McElwain announced Monday Florida Gator redshirt freshman quarterback Will Grier has been suspended indefinitely from the team.  //on.11alive.com/1RD0G83   Join the Conversation To   Florida QB Will Grier suspended indefinitely Jacob Rodriguez & Colette DuChanois, First Coast News 3:24 p.m. EDT October 12, 2015 Florida Gators quarterback Will Grier (7) leaves the field after the win over the Missouri Tigers at Faurot Field. (Photo: Denny Medley, USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
GAINESVILLE, Fla. — Coach Jim McElwain announced Monday Florida Gator redshirt freshman quarterback Will Grier has been suspended indefinitely from the team. 
The announcement came at a 2:30 p.m. press conference with both McElwain and Grier. He tested positive for over-the-counter supplements, which carries with it an indefinite suspension from the NCAA. 
McElwain said he was notified of the situation Sunday and the university has plans to appeal the decision. Grier reportedly took the supplement without knowing what was in it and did not check with the team's medical staff beforehand. 
The coach went on to say that when players take cough medicine they're to check with medical staff. 
Grier spoke at the press conference, admitting that he took the banned supplement and saying that he was very sorry to everyone. 
"I hope people can learn from my mistake," Grier said, just before McElwain came back to the podium. 
McElwain told the media that he stands by his players. "We're in this for these young men. We feel for him. We feel his pain." 
When asked how the football team responded to the news, McElwain said they hugged Grier and told him they appreciated his honesty. 
Sophomore Treon Harris is expected to start in Grier's place. McElwain said that Harris has practiced all the same things as Grier. "Obviously he's got a different skill set," McElwain said of Harris. 
Grier has passed for 1,204 yards and 10 TDs with 3 interceptions this season. 
Grier will still practice with the team. 
Florida has started 6 - 0 (4 - 0 SEC) with Grier behind center. They play LSU this Saturday.
